channel.title: Intellegix
channel.description: AI-generated news briefings covering global geopolitics, domestic policy, technology, and breaking events. Dual-host analysis with Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen. Powered by artificial intelligence, curated for human understanding.
channel.itunes:author: Intellegix News Podcast

item.title: Feb 15: Opening
item.description: Welcome to our comprehensive news analysis for Sunday, February 15, 2026. I'm Marcus Rodriguez, your business and political analyst, and what a weekend of developments we have to unpack today. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 15: Immigration Enforcement Revolution
item.description: Sarah, let's dive right into what can only be described as the most dramatic expansion of immigration enforcement in modern American history. The Trump administration has just unveiled a thirty-eight billion dollar plan to completely overhaul ICE detention, and the numbers are staggering. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 15: Global Security and Intelligence Operations
item.description: Marcus, let's shift to some of the most significant intelligence and security developments we've seen in months. The revelation about Alexei Navalny's death is particularly chilling. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 15: Munich Security Conference and Transatlantic Relations
item.description: Sarah, let's turn to what might be one of the most consequential diplomatic gatherings in recent memory - the Munich Security Conference. The fault lines that emerged this weekend could reshape transatlantic relations for the next decade. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 15: Artificial Intelligence and Technology Innovation
item.description: Marcus, let's dive into what might be the biggest technology story of the weekend - Anthropic's absolutely historic funding round. Thirty billion dollars, valuing the AI company at three hundred eighty billion dollars. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.description: That's our comprehensive analysis for Sunday, February 15, 2026. What an extraordinary weekend of developments across every major sector of American and international affairs. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 12: Opening
item.description: Welcome to our comprehensive news analysis for Wednesday, February 12, 2026. I'm Marcus Rodriguez, bringing you business and political insight on what's shaping markets and policy today. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 12: Ukraine War Escalation and Strategic Shifts
item.description: Sarah, let's start with what appears to be a significant escalation in the Ukraine conflict. Russian strikes have cut heating to hundreds of thousands of people in Kyiv and Odesa, with at least two confirmed deaths. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 12: Asia-Pacific Tensions and Nuclear Developments
item.description: Moving to the Asia-Pacific, Marcus, we're seeing equally concerning military escalations. China has warned Taiwan of "extermination" over planned HIMARS missile deployments, using language that represents a significant escalation in Beijing's rhetoric toward the island. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 12: Trump Administration Domestic Policies and Controversies
item.description: Let's turn to domestic policy developments, Sarah, where the Trump administration is facing several significant controversies. UN experts are warning that Minneapolis ICE shootings may constitute extrajudicial killings as part of Operation Metro Surge, the administration's immigration crackdown i... Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 12: AI Disruption and Corporate Power Struggles
item.description: Marcus, let's dive into what's becoming an AI arms race with significant political and economic implications. Anthropic has just invested twenty million dollars in a super PAC specifically designed to counter OpenAI's political influence. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 12: Technology Products and Platform Evolution
item.description: Marcus, let's examine some major technology platform developments that are reshaping how we interact with digital services. Elon Musk announced that X Money, the payment system designed to transform X into an "everything app," will launch beta testing in two months. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 12: Business and Financial Market Developments
item.description: Sarah, let's examine some significant business developments that are shaping market sentiment and corporate strategy. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has signaled potential lifting of Russian oil sanctions if the war ends, telling Fox News that removing sanctions on Russian, Venezuelan, and Iran... Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 12: Science, Space, and Medical Innovations
item.description: Marcus, let's explore some fascinating developments in science and space that are pushing technological boundaries. NASA's Crew-12 mission launching Thursday will make history as the first mission to allow smartphones in space, representing a significant shift in space technology policies. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

Bad Bunny has completely wiped his Instagram account after his record-breaking Super Bowl halftime performance drew an estimated one hundred thirty-five million viewers and criticism from President T... Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 11: Closing
item.description: Weekly outlook and key threads to watch from the February 11, 2026 news cycle. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 11: Sports & Entertainment
item.description: Bad Bunny wipes Instagram after record 135M-viewer Super Bowl halftime show. GOP congressman seeks federal probe of the performance. Chloe Kim leads Team USA defense amid political backdrop. Charlie Woods commits to Florida State. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 11: Autonomous Vehicles & Space Tech
item.description: Tesla robotaxi swerves to avoid Waymo vehicle in Austin - first documented AV near-miss. Musk unveils plan for AI satellite factory on the moon. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 11: Business & Markets
item.description: Software stocks extend losses as AI disruption fears grip sector - Dassault drops 18%. Google offers buyouts to staff not "all in" on AI. Nearly 70% of shoppers abandon AI assistants after bad results. Owlet partners with PromptCare. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 11: Tech Products & Developer Tools
item.description: OpenAI upgrades ChatGPT deep research with GPT-5.2. DeepSeek expands context window 10x to 1M+ tokens. Moderne launches Prethink for AI coding agents. Google opens free AI agent training. Udemy courses inside ChatGPT. Microsoft patches Notepad amid AI coding security gaps. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 11: AI Safety & Industry Shakeups
item.description: Anthropic exec criticizes OpenAI for chasing "flashy headlines." Claude Opus 4.6 aided weapons research in safety tests. OpenAI fires executive who raised concerns about "adult mode." AI watchdog claims OpenAI violated California law. Half of xAI founding team departs. Microsoft tracks AI "recommendation poisoning." Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 11: Diplomacy & Domestic Politics
item.description: Greece and Turkey sign seven agreements at Ankara summit. Texas Gov. Abbott breaks with Trump on nationalizing elections. Trump privately considers quitting USMCA trade deal. Delivery driver released in Nancy Guthrie case. Bodycam footage shows Border Patrol chief praised agent after Chicago shooting. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 11: Geopolitics & Security
item.description: Ukraine faces nationwide blackouts after Russian strikes. Russia threatens military countermeasures over Greenland buildup. China warns Taiwan of "extermination" over HIMARS deployment. Satellite images show US Patriot missiles on mobile trucks in Qatar. Haley urges Trump on Iran. Iran's president apologizes for protest crackdown. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 11: Epstein Files Erupt
item.description: White House faces questions after FBI file shows Trump made 2006 Epstein call. Bondi and lawmakers clash in fiery hearing. Rep. Ro Khanna reads six names from Epstein files on House floor. DOJ files reveal Epstein hired Philippine team to bury crimes online. Day One Ventures founder responds to revelations. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 11: Opening - Tuesday News Briefing
item.description: Opening segment for February 11, 2026. Epstein hearings explode on Capitol Hill, AI safety bombshells from Anthropic and OpenAI, Ukraine faces nationwide blackouts, Greece-Turkey diplomatic thaw, and 40 headlines across 10 segments. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 10: Transatlantic Tensions
item.description: US-Europe relations hit new lows at the Winter Olympics. Macron accuses Trump of seeking "dismemberment" of the EU. Immigration standoff as DHS shutdown approaches. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 10: Global Flashpoints
item.description: Iran, China, and Turkey security flashpoints. Iran buries nuclear site entrances. Turkey warns of nuclear weapons pursuit. China vows to back "reunification forces" in Taiwan. PROTECT Taiwan Act passes 395-2. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.title: Feb 10: Ukraine-Russia Peace Talks
item.description: Comprehensive coverage of Ukraine-Russia peace process. Russia demands permanent NATO bar for Ukraine. Estonian intelligence assesses Russia is stalling. European defense startups raise record $8.7B. EU drafts five-step plan for Ukraine partial membership. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.

item.description: Opening segment for February 10, 2026. Post-Super Bowl Monday with Ukraine peace talks stalling, AI safety alarming, transatlantic tensions rising, and 60 stories across 10 segments. Hosted by Marcus Rodriguez and Sarah Chen.
